<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(1)</SUP>&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A &#147;change in control&#148; is not referenced in the Interim Letter Agreement with Neil Austrian dated November&nbsp;2, 2010. A &#147;change in
control&#148; is referenced in the new Letter Agreement with Neil Austrian dated May&nbsp;23, 2011 which refers to the Change in Control Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Austrian dated May&nbsp;23, 2011. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(2)</SUP>&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Any sale or transfer by BC Partners or their affiliates of their equity interest in the company, other than a sale with other shareholders, will be
disregarded for purposes of this definition. Any acquisition or continued holding by BC Partners or their affiliates of equity interests shall be disregarded for purposes of the 30% threshold. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(3)</SUP>&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As set forth in the Change in Control Agreement dated in December, 2010. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(4)</SUP>&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As set forth in the Change in Control Agreement dated with Neil Austrian dated May&nbsp;23, 2011. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Agreements with Neil Austrian as Chair and Chief Executive Officer </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Austrian, formerly the company&#146;s Lead Director, Chairman of the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee, and member of the Finance Committee, agreed to serve as the Interim Chairman
and Chief Executive Officer effective November&nbsp;1, 2010 until the company hired a replacement. The company and Mr.&nbsp;Austrian entered into a Letter Agreement dated November&nbsp;2, 2010, that set forth the compensatory arrangements for
Mr.&nbsp;Austrian (the &#147;Interim Agreement&#148;) in order to reflect the unique nature of the newly created interim position until a Chief Executive Officer was hired by the company. On May&nbsp;23, 2011, the Board elected Mr.&nbsp;Austrian to
serve as the company&#146;s Chairman and Chief Executive Officer (&#147;Chair and CEO&#148;). The company and Mr.&nbsp;Austrian entered into a new Letter Agreement dated May&nbsp;23, 2011 (the &#147;Agreement&#148;) that supersedes and replaces
Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s Interim Agreement and sets forth his compensatory arrangements with the company commencing May&nbsp;23, 2011. The Interim Agreement and the Agreement are summarized below. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">55 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Interim Agreement and Non-Qualified Stock Option Award Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Neil Austrian as Interim
Chair and CEO during Fiscal Year 2011 </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In connection with his appointment as Interim Chair and CEO, the company entered into the Interim
Agreement and a Non-Qualified Stock Option Award Agreement (the &#147;2010 Option Agreement&#148;), each dated November&nbsp;2, 2010, with Mr.&nbsp;Austrian to reflect the unique nature of the newly created interim position until a permanent chief
executive officer was hired by the company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under the Interim Agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Austrian was eligible to receive a monthly salary of
$200,000. Mr.&nbsp;Austrian was also granted a non-qualified stock option to purchase 400,000 shares of common stock of the company (the &#147;2010 Options&#148;) under the Non-Qualified Stock Option Award Agreement dated November&nbsp;2, 2010 (the
&#147;2010 Option Agreement&#148;) pursuant to and subject to the terms of the company&#146;s 2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan (the &#147;2007 LTIP&#148;). The 2010 Options were granted with an exercise price of $4.43, and with such other customary
terms as determined by the Compensation Committee under the 2007 LTIP and as set forth in the 2010 Option Agreement. The 2010 Options vested with respect to one third (1/3)&nbsp;of the shares on the grant date of November&nbsp;2, 2010, and had been
scheduled to vest 1/3 on each of the first and second anniversaries of the grant date (each a &#147;Scheduled Vesting Date&#148;), subject to Mr.&nbsp;Austrian, on each Scheduled Vesting Date, continuing to serve as, (i)&nbsp;CEO through the date of
commencement of employment of a successor CEO of the company (&#147;Successor CEO Event&#148;), and as (ii)&nbsp;a member of the Board of the Directors of the company, from and after the employment of such Successor CEO. As discussed below the
Agreement modified the terms of the 2010 Options. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under the Interim Agreement, if Mr.&nbsp;Austrian continued to be employed as interim CEO
through the Successor CEO Event, then as of such date, the 2010 Options would vest (to the extent not previously vested) with respect to 50% of the shares subject to the 2010 Options, and the then remaining unvested shares covered by the 2010
Options would vest, subject to Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s continued services as a member of the Board of Directors on the first anniversary of the Successor CEO Event. In addition, the 2010 Options, unless previously forfeited by Mr.&nbsp;Austrian
pursuant to a Forfeiture Event (defined below), would become 100% vested upon the occurrence of any of the following events: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">if prior to the occurrence of a Successor CEO Event, (A)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s employment as CEO of the company terminates for any reason other
than because of his resignation or for termination by the company for good cause or (B)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Austrian has not been re-elected to the Board, despite having offered himself as a candidate for re-election to the Board;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">following the occurrence of a Successor CEO Event, if Mr.&nbsp;Austrian dies, ceases performing services as a Director upon becoming Disabled (as
defined in the 2010 Option Agreement), or has not been re-elected to the Board, despite having offered himself as a candidate for re-election to the Board (other than following the occurrence of a Director Good Cause Event (defined below)); or
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">immediately prior to the date of any &#147;Change in Control&#148; of the company (as defined in the 2007 LTIP). </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The 2010 Options would expire on November&nbsp;2, 2017, subject to earlier expiration due to certain termination events as described in Section&nbsp;2(b)
of the 2010 Option Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Notwithstanding any of the foregoing, the unvested portion of the 2010 Options, if any, would be forfeited
without consideration if Mr.&nbsp;Austrian resigns or his employment as CEO is terminated by the company with good cause, in either case, prior to the Successor CEO Event or, thereafter, in the event of (A)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s resignation
as a member of the Board, or (B)&nbsp;termination for cause (as defined in the 2010 Option Agreement). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Interim Agreement could be
terminated by either party with sixty (60)&nbsp;days notice to the other, and would have terminated immediately upon Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s death or upon termination of his employment by the company for good cause. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">During his service as Interim Chair and CEO, which ended on May&nbsp;22, 2011, Mr.&nbsp;Austrian did not receive the cash compensation portion of the
company&#146;s 2011 annual retainer for Directors, but he was eligible for the equity portion of the 2011 annual retainer for Directors, which was granted on May&nbsp;3, 2011, as described in the &#147;Director Compensation Table for Fiscal Year
2011.&#148; </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">56 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Neil Austrian as Chair and CEO during Fiscal Year 2011 </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On May&nbsp;23, 2011, the Board elected Mr.&nbsp;Austrian to serve as the company&#146;s Chair and CEO. The company and Mr.&nbsp;Austrian entered into the
Agreement which supersedes and replaces Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s Interim Agreement and sets forth his compensatory arrangements with the company commencing May&nbsp;23, 2011. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under the Agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Austrian is eligible to receive an annual base salary of $1,100,000. Mr.&nbsp;Austrian is also eligible
to earn an annual target bonus (the &#147;Target Bonus&#148;) equal to 140% of his base salary, with such Target Bonus to be pro-rated for the duration of 2011. Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s eligibility for the Target Bonus is subject to performance
targets set by the Board or the Compensation Committee. Under the Agreement (prior to the Amendment as described below), Mr.&nbsp;Austrian had to achieve separate quarterly performance targets determined by the Board or the Compensation Committee of
the Board in good faith consultation with Mr.&nbsp;Austrian. In addition, Mr.&nbsp;Austrian had to be continuously employed with the company through the last day of the applicable calendar quarter in order to receive the bonus earned for such
quarter. For each calendar quarter that Mr.&nbsp;Austrian satisfied the service requirement and the applicable performance targets, he was to be paid the corresponding earned bonus within 2<FONT SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&nbsp;1</SUP></FONT><FONT SIZE="2">/</FONT><FONT SIZE="1">2</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> months following the end of such calendar quarter during which such
portion of the bonus is earned. Unless otherwise determined by the Board or the Compensation Committee, Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s Target Bonus opportunity under the Agreement was in lieu of his right to participate in any other annual bonus plan
applicable to other company employees, except that the Board or the Compensation Committee may administer Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s Target Bonus under the terms of the company&#146;s 2008 Bonus Plan for Executive Management Employees.
</FONT></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On July&nbsp;25, 2011, the company and Mr.&nbsp;Austrian entered into an Amendment to the Agreement (the &#147;Amendment&#148;) to
change his incentive compensation from quarterly targets and payments, if any, to annual targets and payments, if any, with his 2011 performance targets to be the same as the other NEOs. No changes were made to Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s Target Bonus
which remains at 140% of his base salary. The Amendment also provides that for calendar year 2012 and each subsequent calendar year, Mr.&nbsp;Austrian shall participate in the company&#146;s 2008 Bonus Plan for Executive Management Employees
(&#147;Executive Bonus Plan&#148;) pursuant to such plan&#146;s terms and in accordance with performance targets established by the Board or its Compensation Committee. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>2010 Options</U>. Pursuant to the Interim Agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Austrian was granted the 2010 Options, pursuant to the 2007 LTIP. As discussed above, under the 2010 Option Agreement, 1/3 of the 2010
Options vested on the grant date of November&nbsp;2, 2010, and additional 1/3 installments of the 2010 Options had been scheduled to vest on each of the first and second anniversaries of such grant date. The Agreement modified the terms of the 2010
Options. Under the Agreement, 100% of the remaining unvested portion of the 2010 Options (i.e., 2/3 of the total grant) will now vest on April&nbsp;30, 2013. In addition, under the Agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Austrian agreed that his appointment as Chair
and CEO of the company did not constitute a &#147;Successor CEO Event&#148; under the 2010 Option Agreement (which would have resulted in a partial vesting acceleration of the 2010 Options). All other previously disclosed terms of the 2010 Option
Agreement remain the same. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Restricted Stock Grants:</U> Under the Agreement, in lieu of a sign-on cash bonus and to incentivize future
performance, Mr.&nbsp;Austrian was awarded two grants of restricted shares of the company&#146;s common stock (&#147;Restricted Shares&#148;) on May&nbsp;23, 2011 (&#147;2011 Grant Date&#148;) pursuant to the 2007 LTIP. The first grant of 600,000
Restricted Shares is subject to vesting based on a service requirement under the 2011 Restricted Stock Award Agreement (Time Vesting) dated May&nbsp;23, 2011 (&#147;2011 Time Grant&#148;), and the second grant of 600,000 Restricted Shares is subject
to vesting based on both service and performance requirements under the 2011 Restricted Stock Award Agreement (Performance Vesting) dated May&nbsp;23, 2011 (&#147;2011 Performance Grant&#148;), as more fully described below. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>2011 Time Grant</U>&#151;Under the 2011 Time Grant, 100% of the 600,000 Restricted Shares will vest on April&nbsp;30, 2013 if Mr.&nbsp;Austrian is
continuously employed by the company or any subsidiary. If Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s employment </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">57 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
with the company or any subsidiary terminates voluntarily or involuntarily prior to April&nbsp;30, 2013, he will forfeit 100% of the 2011 Time Grant upon such termination of employment unless one
of the following occurs in which case the Restricted Shares will be accelerated: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(1) upon death or disability; </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(2) upon termination without cause (as defined in the 2007 LTIP) from his position as CEO if he is subsequently not re-elected to the Board; or
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(3) upon a change in control. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>2011 Performance Grant</U>&#151;Under the 2011 Performance Grant, the 600,000 Restricted Shares will vest (in whole or in part) to the extent that the
applicable &#147;Performance Condition&#148; and &#147;Service Condition&#148; (each, as defined below) have both been satisfied on or prior to April&nbsp;30, 2014 (the &#147;Termination Date&#148;). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Performance Condition. The &#147;Performance Condition&#148; shall be satisfied: (i)&nbsp;for 300,000 Restricted Shares if the closing trading price of
the company&#146;s Common Stock on the New York Stock Exchange (&#147;NYSE&#148;) equals or exceeds $5.50 for 30 consecutive trading days, and (ii)&nbsp;for the additional 300,000 Restricted Shares if the closing trading price of the company&#146;s
Common Stock on the NYSE equals or exceeds $7.00 for 30 consecutive trading days. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Service Condition. The &#147;Service Condition&#148; will be satisfied for each half of the 600,000 Restricted Shares if Mr.&nbsp;Austrian remains
continuously employed by the company or any subsidiary from the 2011 Grant Date until the later of: (i)&nbsp;April&nbsp;30, 2013, or (ii)&nbsp;the date on which the applicable Performance Condition for each half of the Restricted Shares is
satisfied. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Austrian will forfeit all unvested shares of the 2011 Performance Grant as of the Termination Date, or
as of the date Mr.&nbsp;Austrian voluntarily or involuntarily terminates his employment with the company or any subsidiary, if earlier, unless the shares are subject to accelerated vesting as described below: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Death or Disability. If Mr.&nbsp;Austrian terminates employment with the company or any subsidiary before the Termination Date due to death or
Disability (as defined above under the 2011 Time Grant), the Service Condition will be deemed satisfied, and: (i)&nbsp;to the extent that one or both of the Performance Conditions has previously been satisfied, the corresponding portion(s) of the
Restricted Shares shall vest immediately, and (ii)&nbsp;any remaining unvested portion(s) of the Restricted Shares will vest if and when such Performance Condition(s) is achieved on or prior to the Termination Date. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Termination Without Cause. If Mr.&nbsp;Austrian is terminated by the company without Cause (as defined in the 2007 LTIP) before the Termination Date,
the Service Condition will be satisfied: (i)&nbsp;as of the later of: (x)&nbsp;April&nbsp;30, 2013, or (y)&nbsp;the date on which the applicable Performance Condition for each half of the Restricted Shares is satisfied, if he continues serving as a
Director until such date, or (ii)&nbsp;if he is subsequently not re-elected to the Board (other than following an event that would have constituted Cause) despite offering himself as a candidate for re-election to the Board, on the date he is not
re-elected to the Board. In the case of option (ii)&nbsp;to the extent that one or both of the Performance Conditions has been previously satisfied, the corresponding portion(s) of the Restricted Stock shall immediately become vested. Following a
termination without Cause, Mr.&nbsp;Austrian will remain eligible to satisfy the Performance Conditions with respect to the Restricted Shares (to the extent not previously satisfied) until the Termination Date, as described above.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Change in Control. 100% of the 2011 Performance Grant will vest immediately prior to a Change in Control (as defined in the 2007 LTIP).
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Benefits</U>: Mr.&nbsp;Austrian is entitled to participate in all of the company&#146;s benefit plans on the same basis
as generally made available to other senior executives of the company, except for a car allowance, which he has waived. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Termination</U>:
The Agreement may be terminated by either party at any time and for any reason with not less than sixty (60)&nbsp;days notice to the other, and will terminate immediately upon Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s death or upon termination
</FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">58 </FONT></P>

of his employment by the company for &#147;good cause&#148; (as defined in the Agreement). The company may also terminate Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s employment on less than sixty (60)&nbsp;days
notice if Mr.&nbsp;Austrian becomes Disabled (as defined above under the 2011 Time Grant). Upon Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s voluntary or involuntary termination, the company shall pay Mr.&nbsp;Austrian only his accrued base salary through such
termination together with his then vested benefits pursuant to the company&#146;s employee benefit plans (including, without limitation, any bonus earned in respect of a previously completed calendar year or other vested benefits that
Mr.&nbsp;Austrian is entitled to receive pursuant to the Agreement). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Following his election to serve as the Chair and CEO on May&nbsp;23,

<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Austrian is also subject to a Non-Compete Agreement that subjects him to various restrictive covenants that can limit his post-employment
activity. These include an eighteen month non-competition period that bars employment or engaging in any business for any competitor. Other restrictions include non-solicitation and non-interference provisions. In addition, non-disclosure provisions
protect the company&#146;s confidential information and work product. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Change in Control Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Austrian Dated

date of a change in control (as defined in the agreement). During this period, if the company terminates Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s employment other than for cause, death or disability or if Mr.&nbsp;Austrian resigns for good reason (as such terms are
defined in the agreement) following the change in control, Mr.&nbsp;Austrian will be eligible to receive: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Newman is also subject to a Non-Compete Agreement that subjects him to various restrictive covenants that can limit his post-employment activity.

company&#146;s confidential information and work product. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Retention Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Newman Dated November&nbsp;4, 2010
</I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under the Retention Agreement between the company and Mr.&nbsp;Newman dated November&nbsp;4, 2010, Mr.&nbsp;Newman is eligible to earn a
retention payment of up to $1,937,500 (the &#147;Retention Payment&#148;), if he remains actively employed until the last day of the retention period which expires on the date the company files its Annual Report on Form 10K for fiscal year 2011, but
no later than December&nbsp;31, 2012 (the &#147;Retention Period&#148;). The Retention Payment is payable to Mr.&nbsp;Newman in two installments as follows as long as he remains actively employed with the company until the last day of the Retention
Period: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) the first installment of $937,500 shall vest upon the earlier of: the date in 2011 that the company files its Form&nbsp;10-K for
the 2010 fiscal year, or December&nbsp;31, 2011, and shall be payable to Mr.&nbsp;Newman on the earlier of: within thirty (30)&nbsp;days after the company files its Form 10-K for the 2010 fiscal year or December&nbsp;31, 2011; and </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) the second installment of $1,000,000 shall vest upon the earlier of: the date in 2012 that the company files its Form 10-K for the 2011 fiscal year,
or December&nbsp;31, 2012, and shall be payable to Mr.&nbsp;Newman on the earlier of: within thirty (30)&nbsp;days after the company files its Form 10-K for the 2011 fiscal year or December&nbsp;31, 2012. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The first payment to Mr.&nbsp;Newman under (i)&nbsp;above was made on May&nbsp;11, 2011. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If prior to the vesting of one or both installments of the Retention Payment, Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s employment is terminated: (i)&nbsp;by the company as a result of a termination for cause (as defined in
the agreement), or (ii)&nbsp;by </FONT></P>

termination. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Peters&#146; severance entitlements are conditional upon his execution of a release of claims against
the company and its affiliates, successors and assigns and his compliance with the terms of that release. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Restrictive Covenants
</I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Peters is also subject to a Non-Compete Agreement that subjects him to various restrictive covenants that can limit his
post-employment activity. These include an 18-month non-competition period that bars employment or engaging in any business for any competitor. Other restrictions include non-solicitation and non-interference provisions. In addition, non-disclosure
provisions protect the company&#146;s confidential information and work product. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">61 </FONT></P>

</I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under the Retention Agreement between the company and Ms.&nbsp;Garcia dated November&nbsp;2, 2010, Ms.&nbsp;Garcia is eligible to earn a
retention payment of up to $1,500,000 (the &#147;Retention Payment&#148;), if she remains actively employed until the last day of the retention period which expires on November&nbsp;1, 2013 (the &#147;Retention Period&#148;). The Retention Payment
is payable to Ms.&nbsp;Garcia in three equal installments of $500,000, with the first payment vested on November&nbsp;1, 2011, the second payment vests on November&nbsp;1, 2012, and the final payment vests on November&nbsp;1, 2013 (each, a
&#147;Redemption Payment Date&#148; and collectively, the &#147;Retention Payment Dates&#148;) as long as she remains actively employed with the company until each Redemption Payment Date. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The first payment to Ms.&nbsp;Garcia pursuant to the Retention Agreement was made on November&nbsp;10, 2011. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If prior to the vesting of any of the three installments of the Retention Payment, Ms.&nbsp;Garcia&#146;s employment is terminated: (i)&nbsp;by the company as a result of a termination for cause (as
defined in the agreement), or (ii)&nbsp;by </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">63 </FONT></P>

Ms.&nbsp;Garcia for any reason, the remaining portion of the Retention Payment which has not yet vested shall be immediately forfeited. If Ms.&nbsp;Garcia&#146;s employment is involuntarily
terminated prior to the end of the Retention Period by the company for any reason other than cause, any such termination shall result in an immediate vesting of the remaining portion of the Retention Payment which has not yet vested. Such Retention
Payment shall be payable to Ms.&nbsp;Garcia in addition to any severance benefits that may be payable to her pursuant to the terms in her Offer Letter, as amended, upon separation from employment, or as set forth in any then applicable change in
control agreement between Ms.&nbsp;Garcia and the company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Change in Control Agreement with Ms.&nbsp;Garcia Dated December&nbsp;17, 2010:

2011. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Agreements with Charles Brown, Former President, International Division </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The company entered into an Executive Employment Agreement initially dated October&nbsp;8, 2001 with Charles Brown, who was Executive Vice President and
Chief Financial Officer when the Executive Employment Agreement was initially entered into and who was subsequently named President, International Division in 2005, in addition to his role as Chief Financial Officer which he maintained until a
replacement was hired for such position. Mr.&nbsp;Brown&#146;s Executive Employment Agreement was amended as of July&nbsp;26, 2005 to recognize Mr.&nbsp;Brown&#146;s promotion to President, International Division, amended and restated effective
December&nbsp;31, 2008 to bring the agreement into documentary compliance with Code Section&nbsp;409A, and amended as of April&nbsp;26, 2010 to recognize the addition of a special retention bonus in exchange for the elimination of a walk-away right
which existed under the provisions of Mr.&nbsp;Brown&#146;s Change in Control Agreement in effect at the time. The company was also a party to a Change in Control Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Brown dated December&nbsp;16, 2010. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Payment of Severance Benefits under Executive Employment Agreement for Charles Brown. </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On September&nbsp;26, 2011, Mr.&nbsp;Brown, President, International, was terminated without cause from employment. In connection with his termination without cause and pursuant to the terms of his
previously negotiated Executive Employment Agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Brown received a severance payment of $4,401,209 which included a retention bonus that the Compensation Committee had negotiated with Mr.&nbsp;Brown in April 2010 in exchange for
Mr.&nbsp;Brown waiving his walk-away right under his change in control agreement that was in effect at the time. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Executive Employment
Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Brown Dated October&nbsp;8, 2001, As Amended Effective July&nbsp;26, 2005,&nbsp;December&nbsp;31, 2008, and April&nbsp;26, 2010 </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT

termination without cause in September, 2011. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Brown was eligible to receive the following: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">a base salary of $625,000&nbsp;per annum, subject to annual review and upward adjustment by the Compensation Committee; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>

<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">an annual bonus through participation in the company&#146;s annual bonus plan for senior executives or other bonus plans offered to him; and
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">certain benefits and perquisites. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Brown&#146;s employment was subject to termination by the company or by Mr.&nbsp;Brown at any time, subject to the terms and conditions of the Executive Employment Agreement. In September 2011,
Mr.&nbsp;Brown was terminated without cause from employment. The respective rights and obligations of Mr.&nbsp;Brown and the company depended upon the party that initiates the termination and the reason for the termination. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">64 </FONT></P>

</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Restrictive Covenants </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Brown&#146;s Executive Employment Agreement subjects him to various restrictive covenants that can limit his post-employment activity. These include a 12-month non-competition period that bars
employment or engaging in any business for any competitor. Other restrictions include non-solicitation and non-interference provisions. In addition, non-disclosure provisions protect the company&#146;s confidential information and work product.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Change in Control Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Brown Dated December&nbsp;16, 2010 </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The substantive provisions of the Change in Control Agreement between the company and Mr.&nbsp;Brown dated December&nbsp;16, 2010 accorded with those described above for Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s Change in
Control Agreement dated May&nbsp;23, 2011. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Agreements with Daisy Vanderlinde, Former Executive Vice President, Human Resources
</I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The company&#146;s former Executive Vice President, Human Resources, Daisy Vanderlinde was employed pursuant to the terms of an
employment offer letter agreement with Ms.&nbsp;Vanderlinde, dated September&nbsp;14, 2005, which was subsequently amended effective December&nbsp;31, 2008 to bring the agreement into documentary compliance with Section&nbsp;409A. The company was
also a party to a Change in Control Agreement with Ms.&nbsp;Vanderlinde dated December&nbsp;16, 2010. In August 2011, Ms.&nbsp;Vanderlinde, was terminated and, pursuant to a Separation Agreement, received a severance payment of $1,572,296.
</FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">65 </FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Separation Agreement with Ms.&nbsp;Vanderlinde </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In August 2011, Ms.&nbsp;Vanderlinde was terminated and, pursuant to a Separation Agreement with the company dated September&nbsp;1, 2011, received a total severance payment of $1,572,296, which included
amounts owed to her pursuant to her previously negotiated Employment Offer Letter Agreement and an additional payment to obtain her release of any and all claims against the company. In addition, pursuant to the Separation Agreement,
Ms.&nbsp;Vanderlinde remains subject to certain restrictive covenants, discussed below, for a period of 18 months from her termination date. Ms.&nbsp;Vanderlinde&#146;s severance entitlements were conditional upon her execution of a release of
claims against the company and its affiliates, and her compliance with the terms of that release. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Restrictive Covenants </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Ms.&nbsp;Vanderlinde is also subject to a Non-Compete Agreement that subjects her to various restrictive covenants that can limit her post-employment
activity. These include an 18-month non-competition period that bars employment or engaging in any business for any competitor. Other restrictions include non-solicitation and non-interference provisions. In addition, non-disclosure provisions
protect the company&#146;s confidential information and work product. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Change of Control Agreement with Ms.&nbsp;Vanderlinde dated
December&nbsp;17, 2010 </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The substantive provisions of the Change in Control Agreement between the company and Ms.&nbsp;Vanderlinde dated
December&nbsp;17, 2010 accorded with those described above for Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s Change in Control Agreement dated May&nbsp;23, 2011. </FONT></P>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(1)</SUP>&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Retirement is generally treated as a voluntary termination for all programs and agreements except the 2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan (&#147;2007
LTIP&#148;). Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s 2011 Time Grant and 2011 Performance Grant incorporate the restricted stock vesting provisions of the Agreement, which supersede the vesting provisions of the 2007 LTIP. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(2)</SUP>&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reflects a payment under Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s Change in Control Agreement at earned rate. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(3)</SUP>&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s 2011 Time Grant and 2011 Performance Grant incorporate the restricted stock vesting provisions of the Agreement, which
supersede the vesting provisions of the 2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan under which his restricted stock was granted. A description of the vesting provisions under the Agreement are included earlier in the &#147;Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Neil Austrian
as Chair and CEO during Fiscal Year 2011&#148; section. Amounts shown reflect the value of all unvested restricted stock based on the closing price of the company&#146;s stock on December&nbsp;30, 2011. The amounts shown also assume that
Mr.&nbsp;Austrian does not remain a director of the company. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(4)</SUP>&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s Agreement does not provide cash severance upon termination other than a termination for a change in control.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(5)</SUP>&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reflects a payment under Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s Change in Control Agreement dated May&nbsp;23, 2011 equal to the sum of: (i)&nbsp;two times the sum
of: Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s base salary in effect on December&nbsp;30, 2011 and Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s 2011 target bonus, (ii)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s annualized pro-rated 2011 target bonus, (iii)&nbsp;the product of 18 and the monthly
COBRA premium on December&nbsp;30, 2011 for the type of group health plan coverage in effect for Mr.&nbsp;Austrian on December&nbsp;30, 2011. Under Mr.&nbsp;Austrian&#146;s Change in Control Agreement, if his termination is due to death or
disability after a change in control, Mr.&nbsp;Austrian is entitled to his pro-rated 2011 target bonus, which is $1,540,000 </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(1)</SUP>&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Retirement is generally treated as a voluntary termination for all programs and agreements except the 2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan (&#147;2007
LTIP&#148;). </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(2)</SUP>&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A description of the vesting provisions for stock options under the 2007 LTIP are included later in the &#147;2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan
Vesting&#148; section. Reflects the value of all unvested stock options based on the closing price of the company&#146;s stock on December&nbsp;30, 2011. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(3)</SUP>&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A description of the vesting provisions for restricted stock under the 2007 LTIP are included later in the &#147;2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan
Vesting&#148; section. Reflects the value of all unvested restricted stock based on the closing price of the company&#146;s stock on December&nbsp;30, 2011. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(4)</SUP>&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reflects a payment under Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s Employment Offer Letter dated August&nbsp;22, 2008, as amended December&nbsp;31, 2008 and
April&nbsp;24, 2010, equal to the sum of: (i)&nbsp;1.5 times his base salary in effect on December&nbsp;30, 2011, (ii)&nbsp;his 2011 pro-rata bonus at the earned rate, and (iii)&nbsp;the product of 18 and the difference between the monthly COBRA
premium on December&nbsp;30, 2011 for the type of group health plan coverage in effect for Mr.&nbsp;Newman on December&nbsp;30, 2011 and the active employee charge for such coverage. In addition, under Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s Retention Agreement
dated November&nbsp;4, 2010, he is entitled to a special retention payment of $1,000,000. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(5)</SUP>&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reflects a payment under Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s Change in Control Agreement dated December&nbsp;17, 2010 (&#147;Change in Control Agreement&#148;)
equal to the sum of: (i)&nbsp;two times the sum of: Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s base salary (including car allowance) in effect on December&nbsp;30, 2011 and Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s 2011 target bonus, (ii)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s pro-rated 2011 target
bonus, (iii)&nbsp;the product of 18 and the monthly COBRA premium on December&nbsp;30, 2011 for the type of group health plan coverage in effect for Mr.&nbsp;Newman on December&nbsp;30, 2011. In addition, under Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s Retention
Agreement, he is entitled to a special retention payment of $1,000,000. Under Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s Change in Control Agreement, if his termination is due to death or disability after a change in control, Mr.&nbsp;Newman is entitled to his
pro-rated 2011 target bonus, which is $477,764. The total payments for Mr.&nbsp;Newman under the foregoing arrangement equal $4,131,300. However, these payments are subject to reduction if the parachute amounts associated with the payments under
section 280G of the Code equal or exceed three times Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s average taxable compensation received from the company for the five year period ending December&nbsp;31, 2010, and if he would receive more on an after tax basis by reducing
the payments than he would receive by getting all the payments and paying the 20% excise tax imposed by section 4999 of the Code. The cash severance portion of his payments would be reduced by the minimum amount necessary to bring the total of all
the payments to a level where the 20% excise tax is not triggered. The amount of the reduction in the cash severance would be $395,461, and after this reduction the total payments to Mr.&nbsp;Newman would be $3,735,839. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(6)</SUP>&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reflects a payment under Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s Change in Control Agreement equal to his highest annual bonus earned under the bonus plan with respect
to the 2008, 2009 and 2010 fiscal years; provided that, he was employed by the company at the end of the 2011 fiscal year. Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s highest bonus was earned under the bonus plan during the 2010 fiscal year.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(7)</SUP>&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reflects the value of a 24-month outplacement services package under Mr.&nbsp;Newman&#146;s Change in Control Agreement. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">68 </FONT></P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(4)</SUP>&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reflects a payment under Mr.&nbsp;Peters&#146; Employment Offer Letter dated September&nbsp;20, 2007, as amended December&nbsp;31, 2008 and
April&nbsp;24, 2010, equal to the sum of: (i)&nbsp;1.5 times his base salary in effect on December&nbsp;30, 2011, (ii)&nbsp;his 2011 pro-rata target bonus, and (iii)&nbsp;the product of 18 and the monthly COBRA premium on December&nbsp;30, 2011 for
the type of group health plan coverage in effect for Mr.&nbsp;Peters on December&nbsp;30, 2011. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(5)</SUP>&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reflects a payment under Mr.&nbsp;Peters&#146; Change in Control Agreement dated December&nbsp;17, 2010 equal to the sum of: (i)&nbsp;two times the sum
of: Mr.&nbsp;Peters&#146; base salary (including car allowance) in effect on December&nbsp;30, 2011 and Mr.&nbsp;Peters&#146; 2011 target bonus, (ii)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Peters&#146; pro-rated 2011 target bonus, (iii)&nbsp;the product of 18 and the
monthly COBRA premium on December&nbsp;30, 2011 for the type of group health plan coverage in effect for Mr.&nbsp;Peters on December&nbsp;30, 2011. Under Mr.&nbsp;Peters&#146; Change in Control Agreement, if his termination is due to death or
disability after the change in control, Mr.&nbsp;Peters is entitled to his pro-rated 2011 target bonus, which is $477,764. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reflects a payment under Mr.&nbsp;Peters&#146; Change in Control Agreement equal to his highest annual bonus earned under the bonus plan with respect
to the 2008, 2009 and 2010 fiscal years; provided that, he was employed by the company at the end of the 2011 fiscal year. Mr.&nbsp;Peters&#146; highest bonus was earned under the bonus plan during the 2009 fiscal year. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>

STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reflects the value of a 24-month outplacement services package under Mr.&nbsp;Peters&#146; Change in Control Agreement. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>

of: (i)&nbsp;1.5 times his base salary in effect on December&nbsp;30, 2011, (ii)&nbsp;his 2011 pro-rata target bonus, and (iii)&nbsp;the product of 18 and the monthly COBRA premium on December&nbsp;30, 2011 for the type of group health plan coverage
in effect for Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt on December&nbsp;30, 2011. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reflects a payment under Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s Change in Control Agreement dated December&nbsp;16, 2010 equal to the sum of: (i)&nbsp;two times the
sum of: Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s base salary (including car allowance) in effect on December&nbsp;30, 2011 and Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s 2011 target bonus, (ii)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s pro-rated 2011 target bonus, (iii)&nbsp;the product of 18 and
the monthly COBRA premium on December&nbsp;30, 2011 for the type of group health plan coverage in effect for Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt on December&nbsp;30, 2011. Under Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s Change in Control Agreement, if his termination is due to death or
disability after the change in control, Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt is entitled to his pro&not;rated 2011 target bonus, which is $477,764. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>

to the 2008, 2009 and 2010 fiscal years; provided that, he was employed by the company at the end of the 2011 fiscal year. Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s highest bonus was earned under the bonus plan during the 2009 fiscal year.

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex"></SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In August 2011,

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex"></SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Represents a
payment equal to 2 times Ms.&nbsp;Vanderlinde&#146;s annual bonus at target pursuant to the terms of her Separation Agreement. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(3)</SUP></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex"></SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Represents the
payment of COBRA and other welfare benefit plan monthly premiums pursuant to the terms of Ms.&nbsp;Vanderlinde&#146;s Separation Agreement. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(4)</SUP></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex"></SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under
Ms.&nbsp;Vanderlinde&#146;s Separation Agreement, she is eligible to receive a payment equal to 2 times the sum of her base salary in effect on her termination date with the company. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="tx293362_57"></A>2007 Long Term Incentive Plan Vesting </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under the terms of the 2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan (&#147;2007 LTIP&#148;), upon termination from employment with the company, an NEO&#146;s stock options will vest and be exercisable as follows: If an
NEO involuntarily terminates employment with the company for any reason other than death, Disability, or Cause (as each is defined in the 2007 LTIP), or if an NEO voluntarily terminates employment with the company after completing at least five
(5)&nbsp;years of service with the company, the NEO&#146;s unvested stock options will be immediately forfeited; and the NEO&#146;s vested stock options shall remain exercisable until the earlier of: eighteen (18)&nbsp;months (twelve
(12)&nbsp;months for new grants made on or after April&nbsp;21, 2011) following the NEO&#146;s separation date, or the expiration date of the options. An NEO&#146;s stock options will fully vest upon termination from the company as a result of death
or Disability and shall remain exercisable until the earlier of: twenty-four (24)&nbsp;months following the NEO&#146;s separation date, or the expiration of the options. An NEO&#146;s stock options will fully vest upon termination from the company
as a result of Retirement (i.e., age 60 with 5 years of service with the company) and shall remain exercisable until the earlier of: ninety (90)&nbsp;days following the NEO&#146;s separation date, or the expiration of the options. All of an
NEO&#146;s stock options, including any stock options which were previously vested, will be immediately forfeited if the NEO is terminated by the company for Cause. If an NEO&#146;s termination from employment with the company does not satisfy one
of these provisions, then the NEO&#146;s unvested stock options will be immediately forfeited and the vested stock options shall remain exercisable until the earlier of: ninety (90)&nbsp;days following the NEO&#146;s separation date, or the
expiration date of the options. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under the terms of the 2007 LTIP, upon an NEO&#146;s termination from employment with the company, the
applicable restriction period will lapse and an NEO&#146;s restricted stock will vest as follows: An NEO&#146;s restricted stock based solely on the requirement to continue to perform services shall become fully vested: (i)&nbsp;immediately prior to
a Change in Control (as defined in the 2007 LTIP), (ii)&nbsp;as of the NEO&#146;s date of death or Disability, or (iii)&nbsp;as of the date the NEO has both attained age sixty and completed 5 years of continuous service with the company regardless
of whether the restricted stock was granted before or after the date the NEO satisfied the age and service requirements. An NEO&#146;s restricted stock that contains performance conditions as a requirement for vesting shall vest: (i)&nbsp;pro-rata
at target based on the amount of time that has elapsed from the beginning of the performance cycle through the NEO&#146;s date of death, Disability, or Retirement, and (ii)&nbsp;in full at target as of a Change in Control. If an NEO is involuntarily
terminated by the company for Cause or if the NEO&#146;s termination from employment does not satisfy one of the circumstances described above, all of the NEO&#146;s restricted stock will be automatically forfeited as of the date of termination.
</FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">73 </FONT></P>

February&nbsp;28, 2012, are not deemed outstanding for purposes of computing the percentage of ownership of any other person. Applicable percentage of ownership for BC Partners Holdings, Ltd. (including CIE Management II Limited and LMBO Europe SAS)
is based on 356,410,617 shares of common stock, which includes the as-converted number of common shares underlying the shares of Series B Preferred owned by these entities, which are now convertible into common stock. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex"></SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The information
regarding CIE Management II Limited, which we refer to as CIE, and LMBO Europe SAS, which we refer to as LMBO was derived from a Schedule 13D filed on July&nbsp;2, 2009, jointly by: (i)&nbsp;BC European Capital VIII-1 to 12 (inclusive), each a
United Kingdom limited partnership (&#147;Funds 1-12&#148;); (ii)&nbsp;BC European Capital VIII-14 to 34 (inclusive), each a United Kingdom limited partnership (&#147;Funds 14-34&#148; and together with Funds 1-12, the &#147;CIE Investors&#148;);
(iii)&nbsp;BC European Capital VIII-35 SC to 39 SC (inclusive), each a Soci&eacute;t&eacute; Civiles organized under the laws of France (the &#147;LMBO Investors&#148; and together with the CIE Investors, the &#147;Investors&#148;); (iv)&nbsp;LMBO;
and (v)&nbsp;CIE on July&nbsp;2, 2009. CIE is the general partner of, and has investment control over the shares held by, each of the CIE Investors and LMBO is G&eacute;rant as to, and has investment control over the shares held by, each of the LMBO
Investors. BC Partners Holdings Limited, a limited corporation organized under the laws of Guernsey, Channel Islands (&#147;BCHL&#148;), is the controlling entity of each of (i)&nbsp;CIE; and (ii)&nbsp;LMBO. CIE, LMBO and BCHL are each managed by
separate boards of directors. A list of the directors of CIE, LMBO and BCHL is provided on Schedules II, III and IV to the Schedule 13D filed on July&nbsp;2, 2009 and none of those directors have beneficial ownership of the share held by the
Investors. Since CIE, LMBO and BCHL are managed by boards of directors, no individuals have ultimate voting or investment control (as determined by Rule 13d-3) over the shares that may be deemed beneficially owned by CIE and LMBO. We have no further
information or knowledge about CIE, LMBO or BCHL. The Investors, CIE and LMBO may be deemed to be a &#147;group&#148; (within the meaning of Section&nbsp;13(d)(3) of the Securities Exchange Act) and, as such, may be deemed to be beneficial owners of
(y)&nbsp;274,596 shares of 10% Series A Redeemable Convertible Participating Perpetual Preferred Stock, par value $0.01 per share and (z)&nbsp;75,404 shares of 10% Series B Redeemable Conditional Convertible Participating Perpetual Preferred Stock,
par value $0.01 per share, of Office Depot, Inc., each Investor, however, disclaims beneficial ownership with respect to the shares owned by each of the other Investors, CIE and LMBO. None of the Investors own any shares of common stock over which
it has sole voting, disposition or investment power. The figures in the table set forth the number of shares of common stock, on an as-converted basis, owned of record and beneficially owned by the funds including the as-converted underlying shares
of Series B Preferred owned by the funds, which are now convertible into common stock. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
